1.text: For an object of desire he who is separated doth seek, With all wisdom he intermeddleth.

2.text: A fool delighteth not in understanding, But—in uncovering his heart.

3.text: With the coming of the wicked come also hath contempt, And with shame—reproach.

4.text: Deep waters are the words of a man’s mouth, The fountain of wisdom is a flowing brook.

5.text: Acceptance of the face of the wicked is not good, To turn aside the righteous in judgment.

6.text: The lips of a fool enter into strife, And his mouth for stripes calleth.

7.text: The mouth of a fool is ruin to him, And his lips are the snare of his soul.

8.text: The words of a tale-bearer are as self-inflicted wounds, And they have gone down to the inner parts of the heart.

9.text: He also that is remiss in his work, A brother he is to a destroyer.

10.text: A tower of strength is the name of Jehovah, Into it the righteous runneth, and is set on high.

11.text: The wealth of the rich is the city of his strength, And as a wall set on high in his own imagination.

12.text: Before destruction the heart of man is high, And before honour is humility.

13.text: Whoso is answering a matter before he heareth, Folly it is to him and shame.

14.text: The spirit of a man sustaineth his sickness, And a smitten spirit who doth bear?

15.text: The heart of the intelligent getteth knowledge, And the ear of the wise seeketh knowledge.

16.text: The gift of a man maketh room for him, And before the great it leadeth him.

17.text: Righteous is the first in his own cause, His neighbour cometh and hath searched him.

18.text: The lot causeth contentions to cease, And between the mighty it separateth.

19.text: A brother transgressed against is as a strong city, And contentions as the bar of a palace.

20.text: From the fruit of a man’s mouth is his belly satisfied, From the increase of his lips he is satisfied.

21.text: Death and life are in the power of the tongue, And those loving it eat its fruit.

22.text: Whoso hath found a wife hath found good, And bringeth out good-will from Jehovah.

23.text: With supplications doth the poor speak, And the rich answereth fierce things.

24.text: A man with friends is to show himself friendly, And there is a lover adhering more than a brother!
